tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customer_support_tickets (
    ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name TEXT,
    support_agent TEXT,
    ticket_status TEXT,
    response_time TIMESTAMP,
    follow_up_email TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE support_tickets (
    ticket_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    ticket_subject VARCHAR(100),
    ticket_description TEXT,
    resolved BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE email_follow_up (
    follow_up_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    ticket_id INT,
    customer_id INT,
    follow_up_date TIMESTAMP,
    follow_up_message TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE support_tickets (
    ticket_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    ticket_status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    response_text TEXT,
    response_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerSupportTickets (
    ticket_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    ticket_description TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20),
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerSupportResponses (
    response_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    ticket_id INT,
    response_text TEXT,
    response_by VARCHAR(50),
    response_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE EmailFollowUp (
    followup_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    ticket_id INT,
    email_address VARCHAR(100),
    followup_status VARCHAR(20),
    followup_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerContacts (
    contact_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50),
    email_address VARCHAR(100),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15)
);

CREATE TABLE tickets (
  ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  ticket_details TEXT,
  status ENUM('Open', 'Closed'),
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ticket_responses (
  response_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  ticket_id INT,
  response_text TEXT,
  response_date TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (ticket_id) REFERENCES tickets(ticket_id)
);

CREATE TABLE email_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  template_id INT,
  customer_id INT,
  email_sent_date TIMESTAMP,
  successful BOOLEAN,
  FOREIGN KEY (template_id) REFERENCES email_templates(template_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);
